The therapeutic effectiveness CPAP provide significant , stable , long-term neurocognitive functional benefit patient OSAS systematically investigate . DESIGN NARRATIVE : The study randomize , blind , sham-controlled , multi-center trial CPAP therapy . The principal aim study : 1 ) ass long-term effectiveness CPAP therapy neurocognitive function , mood , sleepiness , quality life administer test index subject randomly assign active sham CPAP ; 2 ) identify specific neurocognitive deficit associate OSAS large , heterogeneous subject population ; 3 ) determine deficit neurocognitive function OSAS subject reversible sensitive effect CPAP ; 4 ) develop composite multivariate outcome measure result study used assess clinical effectiveness CPAP improve neurocognitive function , mood , sleepiness , quality life ; 5 ) use functional magnetic resonance image compare cortical activation CPAP therapy , ass whether change associate improvement specific neurocognitive task performance . The primary endpoint study effect six month CPAP treatment neurocognitive function . A total 1100 subject ( 550 per treatment group ) enrol patient population five site ( Stanford University ; University Arizona ; Brigham Women 's Hospital ; Massachusetts ; St. Luke 's Hospital , Missouri ; St. Mary Medical Center , Washington ) .
